intro: Kamptzia albens, commonly known as the white kamptzia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with compound leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany and horticulture. The plant is also noted for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils and partial shade.
